intro: Pilosella tremipes, commonly known as the trembling pilosella, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its small, yellowish flowers are surrounded by white or pale blue ray florets, giving it a delicate appearance. Pilosella tremipes is often found in meadows and open woodlands, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
